reviews.review_msg: I don't know why Ann isn't rated higher. I always found her classes interesting, relevant and open to discussion. She always gave plenty of time, both in and out of class for assignments and was open to new ideas.  Sure, there is a lot of reading and writing, but I would say the class is worth it!
One of the most difficult courses I have taken at SFU. Requires a lot of time and effort, readings are extremely difficult to understand and assignments are way to time consuming.

Material was extremely hard to understand. I expected this class to be easy but it wasn't. Class average was low. Discussions are marked difficult. Assignments are long and boring. Overall I would recommend a different EDUC course

Exceptional. Best learning experience of my life. Gentle pace, expectations clear, reading and assigment load very manageable. I would take another class from her in a heart beat. She is leaving the U of S unfortunately, SFU is lucky to have her.

Ann is the most kind and caring prof I have ever had.  I totally recommend any of her classes. Her classes are based on student discussion, therefore they are some of the only classes that actually relate to students.
Inquiry based, student centered learning, encourages independent thought. Great class!
I would take another class by her any day.
Wonderful Class Discussion based.  You will learn a lot and learn about materials and yourself.
